creator: robbie_usenet@yahoo.co.uk
text:
Created attachment 31755
Code patch

The documentation for the SignJar task states:
'Timestamped JAR files were introduced in Java1.5 and supported in Ant since Ant 1.7. Ant does not yet support proxy setup for this signing process. '

With Oracle recommending systematic timestamping of JAR files at signature time, adding proxy support would broaden the audience of this task.

added as git commit 7f51882, thanks!

I've modified you patch slightly as you removed the option to only provide a cert without an url, something that might not make any sense but was possible before.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
robbie_usenet@yahoo.co.uk
text:
OK, it was the right call to modify as in Comment 2, well done. I had deliberately removed the option to provide a cert without the URL, but re-reading the documentation I see I had misunderstood this feature and it should actually be EITHER a tsaUrl OR a tsaCert (from which the URL is deduced).

However, the proxy configuration should be used in either case, so you should revert to commit f98f495, since your later refinement means that the proxy config won't get used if there is a tsaCert provided - external communication will still be needed in this case.

creator: robbie_usenet@yahoo.co.uk
text: Sorry, I mean revert to commit 7f51882 - that is, back out commit f98f495

only the proxy< setup code tries to parse the scheme to proxy from the url :-)

If only the cert is given the only thing I think we can do is enable the proxy for http as well as https.  Or is there a better way?

git commit ba17089
creator: bodewig@apache.org
robbie_usenet@yahoo.co.uk
text: I think you have the best version now, we have no way of knowing (short of duplicating jarsigner code to read the user's keystore and parse the certificate inside it) whether to proxy http or https in the tsaCert case. If you wanted to make it even simpler, you could just always proxy both http and https and not even bother trying to work out which one is needed.
